org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.generic

Class MerkleTree<C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.generic.MerkleTree<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - The type determining the range and domain of the collision-resistant hash. The hash function must map a pair of elements of this type to a single element of this type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RandomOracleMerkleTree

    public class MerkleTree<C>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implmentation of a binary Merkle tree commitment using a generic collision-resistant hash.
    See Also:
    CollisionResistantHash

      A node in the Merkle tree.
      class  MerkleTree.PathEncoder
      This is a utility class for serializing a path.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public C getRoot()

      • addLeaf

        public boolean addLeaf(C leafvalue)
        Add a leaf to the tree.
        Parameters:
        leafvalue -
        Returns:
        true if the leaf was added, false if it was already in the tree.

      • getPath

        public java.util.List<Pair<C,C>> getPath(C leaf)
        Return a path from the leaf to the root. The path consists of a list of hash pairs, such that one element of each pair is a commitment to the two elements in the previous pair, and the first pair contains the leaf as one of the elements.
        Parameters:
        leaf -
        Returns:
        the path from the leaf to the root, or null if the leaf is not in the tree.

      • verifyPath

        public boolean verifyPath(C leaf,
                          C root,
                          java.util.List<Pair<C,C>> path)
        Verify that a path is a valid Merkle-tree path from a given leaf to a given tree root.
        Parameters:
        leaf - the leaf at which the path should start
        root - the root of the tree to which the path root is compared.
        path - the path to verify.
        Returns:
        true iff the first pair in the path contains the leaf, the hash of the final pair is the root, and each pair in the path contains the hash of the previous pair.
